citation.excerpt:
1. [Location Relative Attention Mechanisms for Robust Long-Form Speech Synthesis](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1910.10288.pdf)
2. [Tacotron: Towards End-To-End Speech Synthesis](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1703.10135.pdf)
3. [Natural TTS Synthesis by Conditioning WaveNet on Mel Spectrogram Predictions](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1712.05884.pdf)
--resume_checkpoint_path <If specified load checkpoint and resume training>
--resume_checkpoint_path <If specified load checkpoint and resume training>

description.excerpt: This repository contains code to train a End-to-End Speech Synthesis system, based on the Tactoron2 model with modifications as described in Location Relative Attention Mechanisms for Robust Long-Form Speech Synthesis.

A Tacotron2 model with Dynamic Convolutional Attention which modifies the hybrid location sensitive attention mechanism to be purely location based, resulting in better generalization on long utterances. This model takes text (in the form of character sequence) as input and predicts a sequence of mel-spectrogram frames as output (the seq2seq model). 
A WaveRNN based vocoder; which takes the mel-spectrogram predicted in the previous step as input and generates a waveform as output (the vocoder model).
Both the Tacotron seq2seq model and the WaveRNN based vocoder model are trained on a single GPU, using automatic mixed precision.
Prepare the text to be synthesized
Implementation of Location Relative Attention Mechanisms for Robust Long-Form Speech Synthesis
